720777f-a.title: Manhattan: Lafayette Street - Houston Street (East)
720777f-a.text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), north from but not including East
Houston Street, showing the street under construction after the demolition
of buildings which formerly stood there. The construction of the street
necessitated the razing of many buildings in a northerly direction from
Elm Street, which terminated at a point slightly south of Jersey Street,
to Lafayette Place, which commenced at Great Jones Street. The new
thoroughfare was named Lafayette Street several years later.
November 5, 1900.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
William B. Parsons Collection.
720777f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY

720778f-a.title: Manhattan: Lafayette Street - Houston Street (East)
720778f-a.text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), north from but not including East
Houston Street, showing construction work in progress on the Interborough
Rapid Transit Co. (I.R.T.) subway, after the demolition of buildings which
formerly stood there. Lafayette Street was created by the joining of
Elm Street, which terminated at a point slightly south of Sersey Street
with Lafayette Place, which commenced at Great Jones Street. This necessitatec
the razing of many houses which stood between the above mentioned two
thoroughfares. The new street was given its present name several years later.
November 12, 1900.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
william B. Parsons Collection.
720778f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY

720808f-a.title: Manhattan: Lafayette Street - Houston Street (East)
720808f-a.text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), north from but not including East Houston,
to and including East 8th Streets, showing the street under construction.
The building of the street necessitated the razzing of many houses in a
northerly direction from Elm Street, which terminated at a point slightly
south of Jersey Street to Lafayette Place, which comrenced at Great Jones
Street. The new thoroughfare received its present nahwe several years
later, under which was constructed the Enterborough Rapid Transit Co.
(I.R.T.) subway.
January 3, 1901.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
Villiam B. Parsons Collection.
720808f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY

719452f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (East) - Lafayette Street
719452f-a.text:
East HHouston Street, north side, west from Lafayette Street, to
Broadway. These buildings were later demoliihed to make way for the
construction of the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway).
July 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719452f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY

720776f-b.text:

719453f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (East) - Lafayette Street
719453f-a.text:
East Houston Street (running through centre), west from and including
Lafayette Street (left), to but not including Broadway (right), as seen
from Mulberry Street, across the clearance at its N.W. corner with East
Houston Street. The clearances shown on both sides of the street were
created by the demolition of buildings to make way for the construction
of the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway).
March 16, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719453f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY

719456f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (East) - Lafayette Street
719456f-a.text:
38 and 4O East Houston Street, north side, east from Lafayette to
Mulberry (extreme right) Streets. TTue elongated structure (No. 38 East
Houston Street) also bears Nos. 313-319 on Lafayette Street. These buildings
are being demolished to make way for the construction of the Independent
System Subway (Eighth Ave. subwav).
September 26, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719456f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY

719455f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street - Lafayette Street
719455f-a.text:
Houston Street (East), north side, EeaJi Irom and including
Lafayette, to and including Mulberry Streets. Also shown is
Mulherry Street, at the N.W. corner of Houston Street (East).
The view shows building on Houston Street (East), rased in order
to continue the construction of the Eighth Ave., Municipal
Subway System.
February 21, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719455f-a.folder: Houston Street & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY
